alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Collier and northern Mainland Monroe Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Copeland to 8 miles northwest of Big Cypress National Preserve to 6 miles north of Wilderness Waterway. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Loop Road EE Center, Big Cypress National Preserve, Dade-Collier Training Airport, Miles City and Deep Lake. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until these storms pass. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe
